alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE EDWARD... NORTHWESTERN LUNENBURG AND NORTHWESTERN NOTTOWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Green Bay, or 7 miles northwest of Victoria, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Bay around 530 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Prince Edward Station, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Burkes Tavern, Scholfield, Moran, Virso, Jennings Ordinary, Meherrin, and Prince Edward Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
